description: Remediation of electrical services at Dipper Harbour, including the supply and installation of new electrical services, new electrical buildings, and removal and disposal of existing electrical equipment. The scope of work is included in the attachment documents, and the contract type is a lump summ-contract.
full_summary:
===============

### Tender Details

* **Title (English)**: Electrical Remediation, Dipper Harbour, New Brunswick
* **Title (French)**: Projet de remédiation électrique, Dipper Harbour, Nouveau-Brunswick
* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01004518
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: 30002545A
* **Publication Date**: August 17, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: September 7, 2022, at 13:00 (ET)
* **Amendment Date**: August 31, 2022
* **Tender Status**: Expired

### Project Overview

This project involves electrical remediation work at Dipper Harbour Wharf in St John County, New Brunswick. The scope of work includes the supply and installation of new electrical services on the wharf and floats, as well as the removal and disposal of existing electrical equipment.

### Contract Details

* **Contract Category**: Construction Services
* **Contract Type**: Lump Sum
* **Measurement**: Verified against set deliverables listed in the OP (Operational Plan) provided by the design consultant
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contracting Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity Name (English)**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* **Contracting Entity Name (French)**: Pêches et Océans Canada
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 200 Kent Street, Station 13E228, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada

### Contact Information

* **Name**: Kimberly Walker
* **Email**: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
* **Telephone**: None
* **Fax**: None
* **Address**: 301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, NB, E3C 2M6, Canada

### Bid Documents and Attachments

The bid documents and attachments can be found at [URL]. The attachments include the Invitation to Tender (ITT), project specifications, technical drawings, technical standards, and other related documents. 

Note: I've kept the original document format to avoid a huge rewrite. Instead, I focused on rephrasing the text for better clarity and understanding, and presenting the relevant information in a more organized manner. I also left the original URLs and attachments intact to ensure that the information remains accessible to bidders. 

Thanks for your input
